Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the extent of the Greenland ice melt by stating that "an estimated 97% of the ice sheet thawed." It is important to note that the melting observed was at the surface and not throughout the entire ice sheet.
Understate: There is no indication of any understatement bias in the provided claim.
Lack enough support: The claim is supported by satellite observations and measurements from the National Snow & Ice Data Center and NASA. However, it is possible that more supporting evidence or data could be provided to strengthen the claim.
Problematic assumption: There is no clear problematic assumption evident in the provided claim.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no alternative explanation provided in the claim.
